speech: The two are closely related with noticeable differences in learning curriculum. A BS in Engineering emphasizes theories and advanced concepts, while an Engineering Technology degree emphasizes hands-on application and implementation.  This link has a LOT more info. http://century.custhelp.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/220

An engineering technologist is a specialist devoted to the implementation of existing technology within a field of engineering. Technologists often work with engineers in a wide variety of projects by applying basic engineering principles and technical skills. This link has a LOT more info. http://century.custhelp.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/220

Engineering programs focus on theory and design, Technology programs specialize in application and implementation. This link has a LOT more info. http://century.custhelp.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/220
